name: Anonymous
text:
The logical flow of the sessions made it clear, and the gradual increase in difficulty made it challenging yet enjoyable -principals of educational psychology right at play, it was really nice. The PDFs would be nice if they contained all the details and steps discussed in the sessions -like lecture notes- even if they are just links for reference, in case anyone misses anything and wants to go over it again. The slides on the other hand were well-tailored for the sessions, not many details but sufficient to stay on track with the instructor. 

Overall, much as I hate mathematical proofs, the organization of the content and clear visuals of the slides made it smooth and sensible, thank you:)

name: Ø¢ÙŠØ© Ø¹Ù…Ø± Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯Ø§Ù„ØªÙˆØ§Ø¨ Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø²ÙŠØ²
text: I'm thrilled to share my feedback about the Arduino & Robotics Workshop I attended. This workshop provided an incredibly comprehensive understanding of robotics, covering topics like sensors, power sources, actuators, mechanical basics, C programming, and Arduino. The hands-on experience and practical demonstrations were invaluable, allowing us to truly grasp the concepts. The instructor was not only knowledgeable but also great communicator, making complex subjects easy to understand. Overall, this workshop exceeded my expectations and left me feeling equipped and inspired to delve deeper into the world of robotics.
